name: RemoveUserFromTeam
description:
Removes a user from a specified Asana team.

Use this tool to remove a user from an Asana team. The request must be made by someone who is a member of the team.

parameters.name: team_global_identifier
parameters.description: Globally unique identifier for the team to remove a user from.

value_schema.description: Globally unique identifier for the team.

parameters.name: user_identifier
parameters.description: A string identifying the user to be removed. It can be 'me', an email, or the user's gid.

value_schema.description: A string identifying a user. This can either be the string "me", an email, or the gid of a user.

parameters.name: enable_pretty_output
parameters.description: Enable pretty JSON formatting for the response. This increases readability but also response size, so it's advisable for debugging.

value_schema.description:
Provides “pretty” output.
Provides the response in a “pretty” format. In the case of JSON this means doing proper line breaking and indentation to make it readable. This will take extra time and increase the response size so it is advisable only to use this during debugging.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the asana API.

parameters.name: opt_pretty
parameters.description:
Provides “pretty” output.
Provides the response in a “pretty” format. In the case of JSON this means doing proper line breaking and indentation to make it readable. This will take extra time and increase the response size so it is advisable only to use this during debugging.

value_schema.description:
Provides “pretty” output.
Provides the response in a “pretty” format. In the case of JSON this means doing proper line breaking and indentation to make it readable. This will take extra time and increase the response size so it is advisable only to use this during debugging.

parameters.name: team_gid
parameters.description: Globally unique identifier for the team.

value_schema.description: Globally unique identifier for the team.

parameters.name: data.user
parameters.description: A string identifying a user. This can either be the string "me", an email, or the gid of a user.

value_schema.description: A string identifying a user. This can either be the string "me", an email, or the gid of a user.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
